title: TROLL TEE
text:
Introduction
The general idea is to test the ability of TROLL 4.0 (Maréchaux et al. 2024; Schmitt et al. 2024) to simulate a Throughfall Exclusion Experiment (TEE) in Amazonia based on the Tapajos experiment (Nepstad et al. 2002) compared to previous model intercomparisons (Powell et al. 2013) to assess its ability to model the response of tropical moist forests (TMF) to climate change (Joetzjer et al. 2014). Note: Water stress may be underrepresented due to the potential for pre-dawn drought, and this may be an opportunity to improve its representation with explicit tree hydraulic resistance.

title: Species
text:
Currently only LA, SLA, C, and N values are available and alometric parameters can be derived from inventories (see Data/Forest). Additional data will be needed from TRY (Kattge et al. 2019), TALLO (Jucker et al. 2022), and Schmitt et al. (2024).

LBA-ECO CD-02 Forest Canopy Structure, Tapajos National Forest, Brazil: 1999-2003
Cite: Ehleringer, J., L.A. Martinelli and J.P. Ometto. 2011. LBA-ECO CD-02 Forest Canopy Structure, Tapajos National Forest, Brazil: 1999-2003. Data set. Available on-line [http://daac.ornl.gov] from Oak Ridge National Laboratory Distributed Active Archive Center, Oak Ridge, Tennessee, U.S.A. doi:10.3334/ORNLDAAC/1009


Code
read_csv("data/raw_data/CD02_Forest_Canopy_Structure_1009/data/CD02_SLA_measurements_TNF.csv", skip = 22, na = "-9999") %>% 
  rename_all(tolower) %>% 
  filter(functional_group == "Tree", species != "Not provided") %>% 
  select(species, leaf_area, sla) %>% 
  gather(trait, value, -species) %>% 
  na.omit() %>% 
  group_by(species, trait) %>% 
  summarise(value = mean(value)) %>% 
  mutate(trait = recode(trait,
                        "leaf_area" = "LA [m2]",
                         "sla" = "SLA [m2/g]")) %>% 
  ggplot(aes(value)) +
  geom_density() +
  facet_wrap(~ trait, scales = "free") +
  theme_bw() +
  theme(axis.title = element_blank()) +
  ggtitle("N = 54")

LBA-ECO CD-32 LBA Model Intercomparison Project (LBA-MIP) Meteorological Forcing Data
Cite: de Goncalves, L.G.G., N. Restrepo-Coupe, H.R. da Rocha, S.R. Saleska, and R. Stockli. 2013. LBA-ECO CD-32 LBA Model Intercomparison Project (LBA-MIP) Meteorological Forcing Data. Data set. Available on-line [http://daac.ornl.gov] from Oak Ridge National Laboratory Distributed Active Archive Center, Oak Ridge, Tennessee, USA http://dx.doi.org/10.3334/ORNLDAAC/1177


Code
list.files("data/raw_data/CD32_LBA_MIP_Drivers_1177/data/Santarem_KM67/", 
           pattern = ".txt", full.names = TRUE) %>% 
  read_tsv(skip = 16, na = "-9999", 
         col_names = c("year","day","hour","minute",
                       "tas","tas_gf","q","q_gf","ws","ws_gf",
                       "pr","pr_gf","p","p_gf","swdown","swdown_gf",
                       "lwdown","lwdown_gf","co2","co2_gf")) %>% 
  mutate(date = as_date(paste0(year, "-01-01")) + day-1) %>% 
  mutate(date = as_datetime(date) + hour*60*60+minute*60) %>%
  mutate(date = date - 4*60*60) %>% 
  select(-year, -day, -hour, -minute) %>% 
  select(date, tas, q, ws, pr, p, swdown, lwdown, co2) %>% 
  gather(variable, value, -date) %>% 
  mutate(variable = recode(variable,
                           "tas" = "Temperature [K]",
                           "q" = "Specific humidity [kg/kg]",
                           "ws" = "Wind speed [m/s]",
                           "pr" = "Precipitation [kg/m2/s]",
                           "p" = "Pressure [Pa]",
                           "swdown" = "Shortwave radiation [W/m2]",
                           "lwdown" = "Longwave radiation [W/m2]",
                           "co2" = "CO2 [ppmv]"
                           )) %>% 
  ggplot(aes(date, value)) +
  geom_line() +
  facet_wrap(~ variable, scales = "free") +
  theme_bw() +
  theme(axis.title = element_blank())

  select(date, ws, wdir, tamb, tdew, fheat, co2, h2o, p, h, lh, netrad, par, pr,
         nee, r, gee) %>% 
  gather(variable, value, -date) %>%
  mutate(variable = recode(variable,
                           "tamb" = "Temperature [°C]",
                           "tdew" = "Dewpoint [°C]",
                           "ws" = "Wind speed [m/s]",
                           "wdir" = "Wind direction [°]",
                           "fheat" = "Heat flux [°C/m/s]",
                           "co2" = "CO2 [mmol/mol]",
                           "h2O" = "H2O [mmol/mol]",

                           "lh" = "Latent heat [W/m2]",
                           "netrad" = "Net Radiation [W/m2]",
                           "par" = "PAR [umol/m2/s]",
                           "pr" = "Precipitation [mm]",

Cite: Nepstad, D.C., P.R. Moutinho, and P. Brando. 2013. LBA-ECO CD-05 Soil VWC and Meteorology, Rainfall Exclusion, Tapajos National Forest. Data set. Available on-line [http://daac.ornl.gov] from Oak Ridge National Laboratory Distributed Active Archive Center, Oak Ridge, Tennessee, USA http://dx.doi.org/10.3334/ORNLDAAC/1169


Code
read_csv("data/raw_data/CD05_Micromet_1169/data/Rainfall_REE_plots_1999_2006.csv",
         skip = 12, na = "-9999") %>% 
  rename_all(tolower) %>% 
  mutate(date = paste0(str_sub(date, 1,4), "-",
                       str_sub(date, 5,6), "-",
                       str_sub(date, 7,8))) %>% 
  mutate(date = as_date(date)) %>% 
  gather(site, precipitation, -date, -exclusion) %>% 
  mutate(site = recode(site, 
                       "ppt_casa" = "Casa Onca (~1-km)",
                       "ppt_ree_tower" = "Control plot tower")) %>% 
  ggplot(aes(date, precipitation, fill = exclusion == 1)) +
  geom_col() +
  theme_bw() +
  facet_wrap(~ site, nrow = 2) +
  xlab("") +
  ylab("Daily rainfall [mm]") +
  scale_fill_discrete("Exclusion") +
  theme(legend.position = "bottom")





Precipitation data to force the model. ⚠️ not measured at weekend so Monday is three days precipitation. For the moment I have nothing else that D. C. Nepstad et al. (2002) relation to compute avoided precipitation with precipitation excluded = 0.484 precipitation input + 0.073 as I couldn’t get hold of the original data yet. There is also a 60% exclusion reported in Daniel C. Nepstad et al. (2007).

  mutate(date = gsub("band_", "", date)) %>%

title: Experiments
text:
I suggest the following experimental scheme:

Undisturbed historical dynamics

4.0 evaluation / calibration (starting from Schmitt et al. (2024))

TEE (Throughfall Exclusion Experiment) historical dynamics

4.0 evaluation / calibration
dev of TROLL 4.1 for lack of stomatal control
4.1 evaluation / calibration

Projected future dynamics

projected dynamics under several CMIP6 and SSP downscaled projections
effect of diversity?


Obviously limits reflecting other current developments should be mentioned or integrated if ready (microclimate, water table depth, computing efficiency, …) and this could open on future works (forest on shallow water table depth, selectively logged forests).
